definition: to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: Yield front propagates away from the wellbore with the process of sand production.
sentences.chinese: 屈服带随出砂量的增加沿井径向外扩张。

sentences.english: Blame was attached upon Prime Minister Laughton's Cabinet for yielding to the Russians.
sentences.chinese: 劳顿首相的内阁因向俄国人屈服而受到责难。

sentences.english: Hug the monster. Wrestle your fear into submission.
sentences.chinese: 拥抱怪兽，让你的恐惧向你屈服。

sentences.english: "The Reeds"is obviously the epitome of this tragedy in which love succumbs to the feudal ethical code.
sentences.chinese: 《蒹葭》正是这种“爱”屈服于“礼”悲剧的缩影。

sentences.english: And you don’t do it by fighting it. You do it by surrendering to it.
sentences.chinese: 但是并非通过与之抗争，而是向之屈服。

sentences.english: Such teachers succumb to their own melancholy in their interactions with children.
sentences.chinese: 这些教师在与孩子们互动过程中屈服于自己的抑郁质。

sentences.english: Finally, it let go5), surrendering to the pull of gravity.
sentences.chinese: 最终，露珠儿屈服于重力的牵引，放手了。

sentences.english: But why did a once-mighty civilisation succumb to the West?
sentences.chinese: 但为什么，一个一度强大的文明竟会屈服于西方呢？

sentences.english: But we will not succumb to division or suspicion.
sentences.chinese: 但我们从不屈服于分裂或猜疑。

sentences.english: The government says it will not be bullied by the press.
sentences.chinese: 政府声称不会屈服于新闻媒体的压力。

sentences.english: This poor son of a gun would not yield.
sentences.chinese: 不过这个可怜的倒霉鬼没有屈服。

sentences.english: Why choose Gou yield and Revival.
sentences.chinese: 为什么勾践要选择屈服和卧薪尝胆。

sentences.english: But the subtly constructed final text in essence gave Japan its way.
sentences.chinese: 但是最后所立的巧妙的书面协议使日本屈服。

sentences.english: German forces blockaded the city in an attempt to starve the resistant inhabitants into submission.
sentences.chinese: 德军包围了这座城市，想用饥饿使抵抗者屈服。

sentences.english: The yield thickness is the lower limit of elastohydrodynamic lubrication film thickness.
sentences.chinese: 屈服膜厚是弹流润滑膜的下限。

sentences.english: For smaller components, use of a material with a lower yield point is best.
sentences.chinese: 而对于小型元件，则采用低屈服点贴片胶最为适宜。

definition: to acknowledge allegiance to (some regime)/to serve
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
to be willing to/to be ready to/to be content with/accepting (of restriction, sacrifice, risk etc)
